channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: We’re about to see a $1 trillion ‘supercycle’ of investment in batteries to power the grid for AI
item.description: Large-scale battery storage is critical to meeting surging power demands.

item.title: The New Tariff Twist, and a $250 million A.I. Job Offer
Manhattan Has More Secure Buildings Than Most Cities. That Wasn’t Enough.
item.description: Decades of threats have heightened security in New York City. But Monday’s attack in a Park Avenue office building shows the limits of preparedness.

item.title: HPE’s merger with Juniper Networks was approved by the White House for national security reasons: source

item.title: Virginia Education Board Could Oust George Mason’s President

item.title: With Epstein, Trump Betrays His Brand. His Supporters Notice.
item.description: Trump’s handling of the Epstein issue runs counter to the sense that he is an outsider fighting against a hostile class of insiders.

item.title: Global warming and CEO leadership (but make it funny!)
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei escalates war of words with Jensen Huang, calling out ‘outrageous lie’ and getting emotional about father’s death

item.title: AI keeps getting more powerful, making it harder to judge how smart models actually are
item.description: Stanford’s Russell Wald shared a few highlights of this year’s AI Index at Fortune Brainstorm AI Singapore.

item.title: Fleeing Domestic Violence, and the Russian Advance
item.description: “I wanted something decent,” said a woman at a shelter near Ukraine’s border with Russia. “But this is how it turned out.”

item.title: How Did Hunger Get So Much Worse in Gaza?
